intro: Epilobium nassirelinulci, commonly known as the Nassirelulcian willow herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the Onagraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Epilobium nassirelinulci is noted for its ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for various invertebrates.
